dev

zero config wildcard *.dev domains.

To install simply open a terminal and run this command:

$ (View Source)

Any .dev domain is now pointing to 127.0.0.1, and you can now forget all about adding entries to /etc/hosts.

What's going on?

DEV is a small script that installs dnsmasq, a lightweight DNS server, and configures it to point *.dev to 127.0.0.1.

Afterwards it registeres dnsmasq as a LaunchDaemon, so it start's when you boot your computer.

Lastly it hooks into Resolver in OSX, so all traffic on *.dev is piped to dnsmasq.
